Key Arguments: The proposed ACMA powers are a threat to free speech and innovation.
The powers are unprecedented in their breadth and scope, allowing government censorship.
The powers could stifle innovation in the digital economy by giving ACMA too much control over digital platforms.
Government regulation is ineffective in combating misinformation; education and awareness are more effective.
Notable Quotes: I believe that they would be a serious threat to free speech and innovation in Australia.
This is a dangerous precedent, as it would give the government the power to control what information people are allowed to see and hear.
I also believe that these powers are a tip of the wedge into an Orwellian dystopia.
